instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 No chime or image.
threads.message: So I have an 820-3115 that has no image or chime. Iv'e checked all of the rails on the power aliases page in the schematic and found the only one that seems to be missing is PPVCORE_S0_AXG. it measures 0v. Shouldn't it be 1.05V?

threads.title: 820-3115 No chime or image.
threads.message: Oh I did UC this board. I think it originally had no MS light so I reballed the SMC.

threads.title: 820-3115 No chime or image.
threads.message:
It works now?
AXG voltage only appears under heavy graphics load.

threads.title: 820-3115 No chime or image.
threads.message: No still no image or chime.

threads.title: 820-3115 No chime or image.
threads.message:
Is this liquid spilled board?
Do you get now all voltages (apart of AXG)?
Do you note any level drop at VCORE aftter few seconds?
Did you try each RAM slot separately?
Known good working BIOS tested?
